title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: This was a 3 step interview process which ensures they are a reliable and thorough company to work for. I was able to get all 3 interviews completed in one day.
Interview Questions: What my co-workers think of me

title: Strategic Business Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone screening with a recruiter. They were very nice. Then I had an zoom interview with the director. It was about an hour long. We had a great conversation. Learned a lot about the job position and team.
Interview Questions: What is your background experience?

title: Wildlife Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview over zoom, more of a conversation about the position and expectations than a legit interview. Lots of emailing back and forth both before and after the interview takes place.
Interview Questions: What have been some of your past experiences in wildlife and/or natural resources?

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: the interview was more technical, simple clear, more about what you do now, what project you work for in the university, I did not get the job because I had another offer was better than the WVU
Interview Questions: What is your idea of having a successful team

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: they just ask basic question. It's a in-school job so they don't expect you to be know everything. The interview was quick and straightforward. Just be calm and answer all the questions.
Interview Questions: What is your class schedule

title: Social Media Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and relaxed interview with four members of the team. Everyone was very welcoming and introduced themselves and their role. Each person asked one question, about my general experience with social media, marketing and technology.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that would help in this position? Do you have experience with a professional camera? Do you have experience with media programs such as Adobe etc.?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy Online application. Waited two to three weeks before being contacted about the interview process. Scheduled an in person interview meeting with the employer. Received an acceptance email one week after interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What are you looking for out of this position?

title: Multimedia Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process, about a month between applying and getting an offer for an interview, then a month between the interview offer and the actual interview.  The interview offer email also provided files for a WVU branded brochure project to complete for the committee to review. It was 3 weeks until they got back to me with a response after the interview. It was a hiring committee and they had me present my design portfolio in a Zoom meeting, then asked me a series of questions.
Interview Questions:
How do you deal with a lot of projects and quick deadlines? 
Do you prefer working alone or with a group?
What media do you prefer working with? 
Tell us one strength and one weakness. 
Describe yourself in one word. 
What designers inspire you? 
Tell me a time when you had a successful design. 
How do you measure success?
Why are you the best candidate for this position?

title: Neuroscientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Many zoom interviews, then followed by the hiring manager asking for an in-person interview.  Suddenly things changed, my position was no longer needed.  They refused to communicate.  Only knew I was done after following up for 2 months.
Interview Questions: Who cares. Make sure they are actually serious for the position they were interviewing for.

title: Student Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process for interview and resume requirements for work-study positions. Be confident in your skills and you will do just fine. Make sure you know what the job entails.
Interview Questions: They asked about my time management skills.

title: Front End Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Huntington, WV) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: 1 Technical/Personal interview with 4 members of a search committee. The technical interview questions were fair and the personal focused on previous background experience in the subject area. The process felt very fair and the members were pretty friendly
Interview Questions: What is one way to make a web application more accessible?

title: Resident Assistant (RA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very detailed and concise. They encouraged participants to ask them questions or concerns the had about the job. They had a welcoming environment and there were briefing sessions people needed to attend prior to interviews to get a better understanding of the position ahead of time.
Interview Questions: What was a difficulty I had to overcome and how did I get stronger from it.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Clear communication, flexible on time.  Great team to work with.  Hiring process was slow but thats to be expected with a government institution.  Would highly recommend working here to most people
Interview Questions: What is a challenge and how did you overcome it?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview questions. HR wanted to know about social media. One interview that was recorded on zoom. Found out two days later and accepted the offer. Not a bad process, but definitely can be frustrating if you want more in depth questions
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable writing social media posts without faculty guidance

title: Resident Assistant (RA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: The process feels intense and intimidating, but it really does provide a good feel for what the job will be, and the interviewers have all been through the same process and seek to make it as comfortable as possible.
Interview Questions: Roleplay being an RA and interacting with one of your residents for the first time.

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward and not too difficult. Started with a call from HR rep to schedule interview, then a phone interview with both managers, followed by an in-person interview with both managers and a brief meeting with director.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to deal with a difficult customer?

title: Student Lab Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Asked how much you knew about the research they were doing and what you are interested in. Usually did the interview in between classes. Not hard at all.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the research we do?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Rushed. Lots of practical role based questions and hypotheticals. Did not seem personable as there is a panel of reviewers. Communication is slow and there are many hurdles to jump through.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student in distress?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: good relevant questions related to history of work experience. Zoom interviews were welcoming and staff seemed generally interested in the process. Communication was very good and felt confident in the process
Interview Questions: What is your experience with Microsoft?

title: Grad Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, one in campus and the other in the department office. Mostly very approachable and very scenario based. I was actually told I got an offer within the next week.
Interview Questions: They asked about why I wanted the position.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back and easy. It was done over Zoom since no one was on campus. They just asked about my experience and background. Also what else I could bring to the table.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your past jobs?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly simple. After applying, I received an invitation to interview with the boss of my position. There were both behavior questions and other general questions. Overall, the interview was straight forward and very fair.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your teaching philosophy?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview.
 Onsite campus visit. 
Lab facilities tour. 
Mix of technical and non technical questions
Explained the salary and benefits
Described the project
Asked for the key strengths 
Talked about the city and campus
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: We start the offer via email then I interviewed at WVU.  It was a friendly talking and I am not sure how long it was taking!  Most of our talking was based on my resume and he asked about some details and hoppy and family!
Interview Questions: It was based on my resume to know some details and ask about my hoppy!!

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, and was contacted after a month to schedule an interview. Interview was done over video conference with a panel. Interviewers were friendly, and mostly asked questions about work history and explained the details of the job. I was expecting a call about the next step, 2 weeks after the interview, which didn't happen. I was unable to reach out to their HR department, and the job was reposted about a month after the interview date. The WVU career site does a poor job of updating job statuses.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good candidate for this position?

title: Professional Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met with a group of workers in the IT Department and was asked questions about myself, previous experience, etc. I was a little nervous at first, but they were rather casual. Soon the interview morphed into a story telling session. I was called just a few hours later and told they would like to hire me.
Interview Questions: What is the first step you would try when diagnosing a problem with a PC?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at West Virginia University in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Understanding experience, skills, contribution to team, media skills, teaching skills, knowledge of programs offered, key partners, structure of organization, pathways for growth. Need assessment and fit within organization, lots of other stuff asked and reviewed
Interview Questions: Can you afford to live on AmeriCorps salary

title: MindFit Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly simple and felt professional, yet not too uncomfortable. I was very nervous but that didn't deter the interview in any way as two grad students did the interview. We were able to joke a bit as well as take the interview seriously.
Interview Questions: I was asked to give a demonstration on tutoring someone

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: First you start by submitting an application and GRE scores.  They then ask you to come in and the person in charge asks you some questions and vets you one final time.  They really make up their mind before you actually interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do this program?

title: Medical Physicist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It went better than I expected. They called my name and I went in. They asked me a bunch of questions for three hours and I answered all of them. Also I am a student and I don't have any jobs so, don't ask me to fill out these silly forms. This will only make your data look inaccurate.
Interview Questions: How was your college life?

title: Teaching - Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It is a several step process with full documentation and at least three references. There is a dinner the night before a whole day of interviews and demonstration teaching. The agenda is very full.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Quick and fun, received an offer right away and very easy going. The management for students is awesome! They truly care about your school work and want you to be a successful worker and student
Interview Questions: What's your class schedule like, are you involved with any extra-curricular activities

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Smooth, Flexible with time, 2 days after the interview received a call I got the job, then two weeks went by and I didn't here anything till the Friday before.  I started on the following monday.
Interview Questions: Tell Us about yourself

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Technical interview for TA position. Had to show previous classes in the field and demonstrate Microsoft Office tools to other current instructors. Used MS Access and Excel. There were exam help guides to go through. The presentation was a lecture format.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Went in and meet the manager we just talked. Then meet all the staff and discussed what I would be doing. Then talked about availability. Told me that day if I got the job and took it.
Interview Questions: What are your future career goals?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in for an initial interview after a phone interview and was given a result of the interview within 2 weeks. I was introduced to most staff that I would be working with.
Interview Questions: Tell me about Universal Learning Theory

title: Student Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: It was fun and very easy. The whole process took about 20min where they asked me questions about myself. From where I was from to what I could bring to the table and all the things that are in between.
Interview Questions: What are your goals?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview first. After which they invited for the campus interview. All the arrangements were taken care of the HR of the department. The campus interview spanned for two days. I had a dinner with the the Department faculties the first night. It was a casual interview. The next day there were two presentations before various groups: research presentation and teaching presentation. Throughout the day I met various people in the department as well as the college.
Interview Questions: What would your students say about your teaching style?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a combination of group and two private interviews. The group interview showed that you were able to work together with others effectively instead of overshadowing others while ranking safety concerns. Then there were two private interview conducted by a panel of 5 people. 4 of the five people were student resident assistants, and 1 was the resident hall coordinator of a resident hall. Beyond this process, I was also called to two follow up interviews conducted by the Resident Hall Coordinator of the hall I was being considered for.
Interview Questions: They asked situational questions to see how you would respond to a problem. They also asked questions such as "Why do you think you stand out among all of the other applicants?"

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very informal. Random interview questions. It was very laxed to the point that was wondering if it was a casual conversation. Or a real interview. This most certainly due to WVU not giving sufficient training to their employees. They are about twenty years behind any normal enterprise.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time that you dealt with a conflict.

title: Advanced Practice Practicioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very well organized and on time. I met with all people involved in the position I was applying for. It was a long day but it went very smoothly. Everyone was welcoming and easy to talk to. Very open and informative. I felt comfortable and was treated very well by everyone I interviewed with.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working here?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Position was announce publicly, candidates were shortlisted and i was invited for an interview which lasted for about 1 hour by some members of the faculty and later got an email that i have been selected
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: it was a very simple process. They asked me to come in and just made sure my schedule worked with theirs.  I had gotten a reference from a friend who worked that at the time. They didn't need much more after that, I was hired pretty soon after I met with the dining hall manager.
Interview Questions: When can you work and what is your schedule like?

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was formal, very structured yet loosened. The interviewer was very nice and well prepared as was I. They greeted me with a warming smile and I also returned the favor.
Interview Questions: What is your name for the record?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied to be a graduate student and a TA, it was just an online skype interview before coming to school, included some normal behavioral questions regarding study and teaching, pretty easy overall
Interview Questions: what courses have you taken in finance

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got accepted mid February. Accepted as Teaching Assistant for the first year which covers also first summer. After first year, had to find a research adviser. The research facilities are good, and was adequate for my thesis work.
Interview Questions: There was no question.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: First I interviewed with HR, then the actual department, then there was a background check before I could be officially hired. The HR department typed my answers into an iPad, but I am not sure this interview mattered because they sent me pretty quickly to interview with the department. I think the HR interview could only hurt you if you answered questions really poorly or created huge red flags.
Interview Questions: Why are you qualified for this position?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant - Industry Assessment Center Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Very informal interview. As long as you have good grades and are proactive about learning, you will do fine. Dr. Gopala went over my grades and asked what was my availability like. It is important that you are able to make the site visits to the clients to collect the data and get an idea of the work that you are doing.
Interview Questions: Have some understanding about what the IAC is.

title: Guest Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: They take each student through two interviews, one is a general interview to get to know the candidate and the second one will be for the specific position they feel you would be a good fit for. In the first interview, they learn your skills and in the second one, there are many behavioral questions to see how you would respond to situations. Both interviews will include 3 or more interviewers.
Interview Questions: What is your definition of good customer service

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy, didn't have to answer too many questions.  Just on my school schedule as well as previous work history.  Also asked if I previously had experience in a kitchen or worked in a restaurant setting before.
Interview Questions: If the kitchen was under staffed how could you help?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV)
Interview Descriptions: This position was offered as part of my scholarship for attending the graduate program. As in most cases receiving the offer was directly tied to my application to graduate school. I did not have to but I visited the department months before I was offered the position officially and had a brief discussion with the director. After that they based my assignment on the skills I described in my resume.
Interview Questions: Knowing what sort of research I was interested in working in order to properly assign me to a faculty member.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Received email for campus visit.  The campus visit was casual. Had to meet few professors and talk to them about research experiences. After the campus visit received the official letter.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was relatively brief. The position was focused on being a resource to engineering students so the questions were primarily related to the topics of to be studied. Both interviewers were very friendly and easy to contact during the hiring process
Interview Questions: What are previous teaching or tutoring experiences?

title: Lead Screening Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The director seemed very energetic and happy about the company.  He talked about the history of the company and upcoming processes very passionately.  The other employees seemed like they were annoyed about being there.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?  How do you handle bad attitudes?  What are your strongest attributes?  What can you bring to the company?

title: Arts & Entertainment Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sit down with 3 interviewers. My immediate supervisor, then the managers above them. Very relaxed atmosphere with basic questions. The interview process went smoothly. You need to be prepared when coming into the interview. Being prepared is key and you have to stay relaxed.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you have helped someone.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the university. It's easy to get accepted as long as you have a decent G.P.A. and good rapport with professors.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Night Staff Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: simple process
Interview Questions: all questions are ok and easy to respond

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Notifications for the positions were broadcasted. I applied for the position. Resume filterations are done and some times references are helpful. Called for the interview on so and so day and time. Its a one on one interview.
Interview Questions: How am I related to job?

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: This is a land grant institution. Know how your teaching methods work with such schools. Additionally, be prepared to ask questions and teach a class.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: GTA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Multiple phone interviews after acceptance. Panel interview the first day.
Interview Questions: What do you plan to research for your Masters Thesis.

title: Communications Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was really simple. I submitted my resume to HR, I was given a call by my now supervisor, the VP of Communications, and he asked me to come in for an interview. I interviewed with him and one of his other employees. The interview lasted about 30 minutes and they asked me about my experiences in and out of class. I informed them that I had to make a decision about another internship by the next day, however that I preferred to work for them, and they let me know within 24 hours that I was hired. Over all a very good experience.
Interview Questions: They asked my about my experience with web design and I had not had any.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Typical academic interview.  Started with meeting almost every faculty member in their office for a half hour or so.  Then gave a technical talk on my research with only about a 5 minute break.  Immediately after that I met with graduate students, then was taken out to dinner.  Met with more faculty the following day.  While non-stop and exhausting to be "on your game" for the whole day explaining and re-explaining your research, it's really a pretty easy interview process without any formal technical interview.
Interview Questions: There were only questions related to my talk, but otherwise it's just basic meet and greet type questions and having to intelligently explain my research.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV)
Interview Descriptions: they talk to you and see your strengths and your ability to communicate, they see you one by one and then they go out with you for lunch and then invite you for a presentation about your work and knowledge and students plus faculty ask you questions
Interview Questions: There wasn't anything unexpected

title: Extension Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at West Virginia University
Interview Descriptions: Process involves a large interview committee
Interview Questions: didn't expect questions related to social justice

title: Mountaineer Maniacs Budget Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about two weeks, and it did not seem like it was officially run. You had to send in your resume and a headshot. I was contacted to come in for an interview- which was very informal and was given by another team member that was already employed by mountaineer maniacs. I was asked a lot of questions- mostly about my past experiences- basically if you have not handled the exact amount of money they had you were not getting the job.
Interview Questions: How much money have you handled in the past?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV)
Interview Descriptions: There was no formal interview; I was already familiar with the department from prior experience. I was asked when I could begin working.
Interview Questions: Again, no formal interview.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview process--they were looking for someone who was nice and efficient with Microsoft Office programs.  Up front they told me it would involve a lot of data entry for accounting of classes and phone bills.  The whole process was quite straight forward and taken care of in one interview.
Interview Questions: No tricky questions involved.  They wanted a person who can do data entry.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at West Virginia University (New York, NY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: 20 minutes Phone Interview. Discussed experience and what is your strength in the related field. Educational background was asked. Also described how will you handle the students in a big class. Asked about your plan if you got offered the position. Not difficult conversation.. Nice talking with the search committee member. Be yourself.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in this field

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: First we need to e-mail the respective person asking for any positions. If there is as availability, then the interviewer schedules an appointment with us. Then we need to attend the interview and if we are good at it, we will be selected.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Fund Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 5 individuals.  The group had a list of questions they went through so quickly that they couldn't have been listening to my answers.  They didn't ask any follow up questions or for any additional information.  I believe I was the candidate that met a legal requirement.   I asked about the culture of the department and the response was that they have parties on peoples birthdays. Not what I would have expected from a department within a well known university.
Interview Questions: How did you prepare for this interview?

title: Professional Technologist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interviews are always first then personal interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell us about some of the project you have accomplished.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had to apply for the Economics program and they gave me an assitantship and a job. I met with the head of the economics department and he asked me a lot of questions. I answered those questions and then I decided to go to WVU.
Interview Questions: Can you handle complex mathematics and do you have a strong interest in economics.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: When you get accepted to the university Graduate program you get to work with a professor. That is how the hiring process work here. Once you identified your professor and his research group or if department gives you a Teaching Assistant job, they will determine your salary. The interviews are not that hard. Read the research project reports and the publications of the professors that you are planning to work with. You will find some professors have advertised their work on university/ department web page.
Interview Questions: When are you planning to graduate? ( they ask this question because funding is limited)

title: Student Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Apply for jobs that fit your educational background - financial managers have no incentive to hire a nursing or engineering student over a business major, regardless of how good your GPA is.  Make sure to check your facebook account for information you don't want your boss to see - this is definitely checked by the departments to weed out people.  Relax and be pleasant, they are mostly looking to see if you're a good fit with the department.  Don't try to bluff on things you don't know.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with Excel?  Do you know how to use pivot tables and vlookup?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Face to face, lab touring. My adviser displayed what he was doing and was going to do for research and tried to see if I have any feedback to that.
Interview Questions: None, if you are the people doing related research.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very quick interview process, they called right away and scheduled an interview at my convenience. The paperwork took the longest to submit. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. I would advice anyone applying for this position to stay calm and be yourself. After all, you don't want to work in a job that you hate. The questions asked will help them decide if you are a right fit or not.
Interview Questions: Background experience and situational questions

title: Post Doc Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at West Virginia University in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Hiring takes in average 4-5 months. However the requirements are pretty low. Interview only with hiring PI, some times one more person from the lab. They appreciate if people are planning to stay in Morgantown for the next 5-7 years.
Interview Questions: Marital Status

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, applied to the school online. They got back to me in a timely manner. Were very helpful in setting me up, helped me pick a research topic and supported me and allowed for timely completion of my research.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by the professor and scheduled for an interview and labs tour.  Interview was a grilling session on the technical aspects of mechanical engineering basics, materials, fuel cells (primary area of research). Resume review and questions all the past experience I had. Next round a ppt on my academic projects and followed by questionnaire.
Interview Questions: Explain detail roles of each component of a SOFC?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at West Virginia University (Morgantown, WV) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: First I sent my transcrip resume, personal statement and CV to West Virginia University, after they review my documents, they gave me an interview. I am interviewed by my advisor, the graduate director and the dean in the department. They ask me a couple of technique questions to judge my major background. I responded with a satisfying answer. Finally they decided to hire me.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are qualify for our master student here?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
